item.title: Mentioned by Ottawa Citizen
item.description:
Conservative MP seeking vote on sex-selection abortion gets curt reception from ...
Photograph by: Fred Chartrand/The Canadian Press , Postmedia News. OTTAWA — A Conservative MP who wants parliamentarians to vote on his motion to condemn sex-selection abortions was given a curt brush-off Wednesday by a parliamentary committee that decided if the issue will come to the floor of the House of Commons. ... Warawa, other MPs, and journalists were instructed to leave the room. Committee chair Joe Preston soon emerged to say a decision had been made but he would reveal no details.
